revised_title: Conduction Mechanisms in Mimosa Pudica Stem and Leaf
tldr: The author conducted experiments on Mimosa pudica to study the conduction of excitation in its stem and leaf. They discovered that there are two types of conduction mechanisms: one through the wood, as proposed by Ricca, and another, faster form of conduction over a short distance in the phloem and cambium region. This research helps to understand the differences in conduction mechanisms between stem and leaf tissues in Mimosa pudica.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Physiology
